text.section: Within 2 days after the content and arrangement of the ballot are certified under § 9-207 of this subtitle, a registered voter may seek judicial review of the content and arrangement, or to correct any other error, by filing a sworn petition with the circuit court for Anne Arundel County.

The circuit court may require the State Board to:
correct an error;
show cause why an error should not be corrected; or
take any other action required to provide appropriate relief.

If an error is discovered after the ballots have been printed, and the State Board fails to correct the error, a registered voter may seek judicial review not later than the second Monday preceding the election.
